parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
sortBy is used to sort the result-set in ascending or descending order according to selected field. The value of this param is one of available fields on task schedule objects.
**Example:** `name`, `periode`, `flow`, `hubId`, etc.
**Default:** `createdTime`

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
sortOrder is to decide ascending or descending order
**Example:** `asc` or `desc`.
**Default:** `desc`

parameters.name: name
parameters.description:
finding data by name task scheduler.
**Example:** `Morning`

parameters.name: flow
parameters.description:
The unique name of organization's flow.
Use Flow /flows API to get the list of flow names.
**Example:** `Visit`

parameters.name: flowId
parameters.description:
The identifier for the flow that generated by system. Use Flow /flows API to get the list of flow id.
**Example:** `63d8c9b0dbd5ef20a627dd86`

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
finding data running on SUCCESS or FAILED, acceptable value:SUCCESS,FAILED.
**Example:** `SUCCESS`

parameters.name: assignee
parameters.description:
User email for a given task.
**Example**: `worker@paket.id,jhon@paket.id`

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
Fields is for selecting the specific fields that you can choose by multiples to show in the response using a string with a comma delimiter.
**Example:** `name,periode,hubId`.

parameters.name: scheduleId
parameters.description:
Unique identifier for the task schedule that generated by system.
**Example**: `6352736c628401059b37a2e2`

success.description: Total number of success created schedule.

failed.description: Total number of failed created schedule.

schedules.description: List result of created task schedule.

failed_index.description: List of failed index of schedule.

parameters.name: scheduleId
parameters.description:
Unique identifier for the task schedule that generated by system.
**Example**: `6352736c628401059b37a2e2`

patch.summary: Update partially task schedule by ID

parameters.name: scheduleId
parameters.description:
Unique identifier for the task schedule that generated by system.
**Example**: `6352736c628401059b37a2e2`

parameters.name: scheduleId
parameters.description:
Unique identifier for the task schedule that generated by system.
**Example**: `6352736c628401059b37a2e2`

name.description:
The name of task schedule. User can define task schedule name with task's flow name combined with running time, or something else.
**Example**: `Daily Morning Visit`

periode.description:
There are 5 types of periode: **daily**, **weekly**, **monthly**, **byDate**, **custom**. Period of time when the task scheduler running.
**Example:** `daily`

flow.description:
The unique name of organization's flow. Use Flow /flows API to get the list of flow names.
**Example:** `Visit`

flowId.description:
The Identifier of organization's flow. Use Flow /flows API to get the list of flow ids.
**Example:** `67be687c128306111e022022`

startTime.description:
Start date of task scheduler to active. this field only available when periode's value is one of: **daily**, **weekly**, **monthly**
**Example:** `2022-11-02`

endTime.description:
End date of task scheduler to active. this field only available when periode's value is one of: **daily**, **weekly**, **monthly**
**Example:** `2022-11-05`

task.description:
data of task according to selected flow.
**Example:**
`{`
`'receiverName':'miguel',`
`'coordinates':'-6.230815251,106.75684387',`
`'address':'rawamangun jakarta timur'`
`}`

assignee.description: List of user email that will be assigned to the generated task. **Example:** `['jhon@sample.com']`

interval.description:
Number units of frequency between each scheduled execution. For example, an interval of 2 with a frequency of daily means the task will run every 2 days. This required when select the custom periode.
**Example:** `daily`

frequency.description:
Specified unit of time for the scheduling interval. Determines how often the scheduled task will run based on the interval value.This required when select the custom periode.
**Example:** `daily`

schedules.description: Object with format according to value of periode. Configuration for the time of task scheduler will run.

time.description: Time of the task schedule will be executed. **Example:** `07:00`

schedules.description: Object with format according to value of periode. Configuration for the time of task scheduler will run.

day.description: Day of the task schedule will be executed. **Example:** `sunday`

time.description: Time of the task schedule will be executed. **Example:** `07:00`

schedules.description: Object with format according to value of periode. Configuration for the time of task scheduler will run.

date.description: Date of the task schedule will be executed. **Example:** `10`

time.description: Time of the task schedule will be executed. **Example:** `07:00`

schedules.description: Object with format according to value of periode. Configuration for the time of task scheduler will run.

date.description: Date of the task schedule will be executed. **Example:** `2024-01-02`

time.description:
Time of the task schedule will be executed.
**Example:** `07:00`

time.description: Time of the task schedule will be executed. **Example:** `07:00`

schedules.description: Object with format according to value of periode. Configuration for the time of task scheduler will run.

day.description: Day of the task schedule will be executed. **Example:** `sunday`

time.description: Time of the task schedule will be executed. **Example:** `07:00`

schedules.description: Object with format according to value of periode. Configuration for the time of task scheduler will run.

date.description: Date of the task schedule will be executed. **Example:** `10`

time.description: Time of the task schedule will be executed. **Example:** `07:00`

hubId.description:
The identifier for the hub that generated by system. Use GET /hubs API to get the list of Hub IDs.
**Example:** `634e98498ce07d29474a7e29`

name.description:
The name of task schedule. User can define task schedule name with task's flow name combined with running time, or something else.
**Example**: `Daily Morning Visit`

periode.description:
There are 5 types of periode: `daily`, `weekly`, `monthly`, `byDate`, `custom`. Period of time when the task scheduler running.
**Example:** `daily`

flow.description:
The unique name of organization's flow. Use Flow /flows API to get the list of flow names.
**Example:** `Visit`

startTime.description:
Start date of task scheduler to active. this field only available when periode's value is one of:
`daily`, `weekly`, `monthly`
**Example:** `2022-11-02`

endTime.description:
End date of task scheduler to active. this field only available when periode's value is one of:
`daily`, `weekly`, `monthly`
**Example:** `2022-11-05`

task.description:
data of task according to selected flow.
**Example:**
`{`
`'receiverName':'miguel',`
`'coordinates':'-6.230815251,106.75684387',`
`'address':'rawamangun jakarta timur'`
`}`

schedules.description:
Object with format according to value of periode. Configuration for the time of task scheduler will run.
**Example for periode of** `daily`:
`[{`
`'time':['07:00']`
`}]`
**Example for periode of** `weekly`:
`[{`
`'day':'sunday',`
`'time':['07:00']`
`}]`
**Example for periode of** `monthly`:
`[{`
`'date':'1',`
`'time':['07:00']`
`}]`
**Example for periode of** `byDate`:
`[{`
`'date':'2022-11-03',`
`'time':['07:00']`
`}]`

day.description:
Name of day in a week. `day` is required when *periode* value is `weekly`.
**Example:** `sunday`

time.description:
Time of the task schedule will be executed.
**Example:** `07:00`

date.description:
Date of task schedule will be executed. `date` is required when *periode* value is `monthly` or `byDate`.
**Example for monthly periode**: `1`
**Example for byDate periode**: `2022-11-03`
